body:
*Title*: *Disabled per-route filter still buffers grpc stream request data*

*Description*:
We are looking at using envoy as perimeter proxy, a replacement for nginx, serving both websites routes and grpc routes.

For the websites we are using Http::Filter buffer for the request buffering.
We are turning off buffering for grpc routes using route per-filter-config envoy.filter: disabled: true

But we observe the buffer is not disabled and keeps buffering.

as we are getting 
```
2019/01/04 14:45:33 Failed to receive a note : rpc error: code = Unknown desc = request timeout
exit status 1
```

and we observe via tcpdump the server not getting the request data.

Upstream and downstream use http/2

Read the code a little bit, and when the filter is disabled per route, there is a check for disabled in 
`decodeHeaders`
https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy/blob/master/source/extensions/filters/http/buffer/buffer_filter.cc#L78

but seems there is no check in 
`decodeData`
https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy/blob/master/source/extensions/filters/http/buffer/buffer_filter.cc#L92
so it seems it keeps buffering even with disabled buffer for a route.

Does it make sense?
Please advise if just adding the disabled condition to the `decodeData` of the disabled buffer filter would solve it, or am I missing something? 

*Repro steps*:

Prepared the test server and client (fork of github.com/grpc/grpc-go https://github.com/grpc/grpc-go/compare/master...vladimir-spotify:demonstrating_envoy_per_filter_buffer_disabled_bug?expand=1 ) which communiate via grpc streaming.

```bash
git clone --single-branch --branch demonstrating_envoy_per_filter_buffer_disabled_bug git@github.com:vladimir-spotify/grpc-go.git
cd grpc-go/examples/route-guide

go run go run server/server.go

go run client/client.go -server_addr=0.0.0.0:8444
```

observe the request timeout being thrown in the client output:
```
2019/01/04 16:14:59 Failed to receive a note : rpc error: code = Unknown desc = request timeout
exit status 1
```

instead of a stream of data from the client like this, when the buffer is disabled globally:
```
2019/01/04 16:23:44 Got message Third message at point(0, 3)
2019/01/04 16:23:44 Got message Sixth message at point(0, 3)
2019/01/04 16:23:44 Got message Third message at point(0, 3)
2019/01/04 16:23:44 Got message Sixth message at point(0, 3)
...
```

Does it make sense?


*Admin and Stats Output*:
>Include the admin output for the following endpoints: /stats,
/clusters, /routes, /server_info. For more information, refer to the
[admin endpoint documentation.](https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/operations/admin)

*Config*:
```
admin:
  access_log_path: "stdout"
  address:
    socket_address: { address: 0.0.0.0, port_value: 8001 }
static_resources:
  clusters:
  - name: routeguide
    hosts: [{ socket_address: { address: 0.0.0.0, port_value: 10000 }}]
    type: STATIC
    connect_timeout: 10s
    http2_protocol_options: {}
    protocol_selection: USE_CONFIGURED_PROTOCOL
    max_requests_per_connection: 10000
  listeners:
  - name: gostreamingexample
    address:
      socket_address:
        address: 0.0.0.0
        port_value: 8444
    filter_chains:
      filters:
      - name: envoy.http_connection_manager
        config:
          access_log:
          - name: envoy.file_access_log
            config:
              path: "stdout"
          request_timeout: 5s
          http_filters:
          - name: envoy.buffer
            config:
              max_request_bytes:
                value: 51200
              max_request_time: 3s
          - name: envoy.router
          route_config:
            name: streamchat
            virtual_hosts:
              - name: edge_grpc2
                domains: ['*']
                routes:
                  - match: 
                      path: /routeguide.RouteGuide/RouteChat
                      case_sensitive: false
                    route:
                      cluster: routeguide
                      timeout: 5s
                      retry_policy:
                        retry_on: 5xx
                        num_retries: 0
                    per_filter_config:
                      envoy.buffer:
                        disabled: true
          use_remote_address: true
          idle_timeout: 600s
          stat_prefix: ingress_lb
```
